name: Flippin' Hexes
description:
Flippin' Hexes is NOT another free addictive match three puzzle game.

It’s a free addictive match FOUR puzzle game, so it’s completely different.

Flippin’ Hexes is a unique, strategic twist on the color matching genre which is refreshingly distinct from other matching and hex based puzzle games currently available for mobile.

Flip to colour

Flip colourless hexes to give them a colour. But you can only flip hexes that touch the last one you flipped. Matching four or more touching colours will EXPLODE! them, freeing those hexes for new colours. Just don’t block yourself in.

It sounds easy, but with limited board space, Baddies that will mess with your hexes, various board arrangements, and up to six colours to balance, you’ll find yourself making difficult strategic decisions and weighing risks.

Powers!

Every match gives you energy that can be used to activate exciting abilities to increase your options (and your odds of beating those high scores):

- Swap: Switch the current and next colours

- Foresight: See which colour will appear in 3 turns

- Jump: Place your next hex on any colourless space

- Bomb: Remove all hexes in an area

- Multi: Place a hex that will match with any colours it touches

Three Game Modes

Classic

Powers are limited to swapping between your current and next colours, and seeing which colour will appear in 3 turns. Know when to save and when to use your energy.

Super

All powers are available providing you have the energy.  More complexity, more strategic options. Dominate the board.

Challenge

You can always see which colour will appear in 3 turns, but you don’t have any other powers. Success is completely dependent on strategic planning.

Other Highlights

- Addictive, easy to learn, hard to master gameplay

- Match hexes on subsequent turns to create a chain for even more points

- Minimalist design, but also EXPLOSIONS!

- Colorblind mode

- Night mode

- Leaderboards

- Achievements

- Free (non-intrusive adverts with the option to remove for $0.99)
